text: Earlier this year we talked about the concept of Utopia in communication. Utopia is a concept in which we can relate a lot of technological inventions and discoveries. This concept is based on the criticism of here and now, with a necessity and also possibility of change, with a speech of hope. The goal is to remobilize everyone with an ideal, which must to be a project. This type of speech give it place to job like happiness manager for exemple. To talk about inventions, Internet, in the end, is based on a Utopia. A big concept related to Utopia, and very present today, is the Universal Association by Alex Dupont. The goal here is to first criticize the Ancien Régime with a wish of equality, community. The goal is to create networks to make the information, so knowledge, travel and meet the population. As I said, this is a criticism of the here and now because Alex Dupont is obviously against the society, judged non fair enough. Father of the network philosophy, he puts in the front row the link between reticular technique and the political potential of the notion of network. This concept have changed a lot of things. It’s a logical explanation of all the technological inventions we went through and we go in. If we think about it the Internet we know now is part of a pacific revolution by the californian culture of the 70’s. They wanted to create a society in the actual society but without the government. We can clearly see the criticism here. The fact that a Military technology has been taken for this purpose is exactly the definition of an Utopia. And As I explained, this is just a small part of the concept of Utopia for this topic. Utopia brought us a lot of technology and if certain person didn’t go against the society, didn’t criticize it we probably wouldn’t have Internet.
